moves.1... d5: The second most popular move, after 1… e5.
moves.2. Bb2 Bg4: A very strange move, more popular is 2… Nf6, but practice favours black after 2… Bg4, and no so much with 2… Nf6.
moves.3. f3: !? The Litus Gambit, strange-looking at first, but very fun to play.
moves.5... Nf6 6. Qe2: !? This is where the Litus Gambit starts to look even stranger. The queen now blocks in the f1-bishop, and it should be clear to black that the queen wants to go to b5, forking the king and bishop.
moves.6... exf3 7. Qb5+: The bishop can block, but the b7-pawn is unprotected.
moves.7... Bd7 8. Qxb7 Bc6: ?? A losing blunder, much better was 8… Nc6! developing a piece and allowing the queen to protect the rook, but now things are going to start looking very ugly for black.
moves.9... f2+ 10. Kxf2 Qxd2+: The threats on the white king are nothing, and the queen on d2 will provide as a target for white.
moves.11. Nge2 Ng4+ 12. Kf1: The only move which doesn't lose.
moves.12... Ne3+ 13. Kg1 Bxb5 14. Nxb5: Remember that if it wasn't for the queen on d2, then Qc8 would be mate.
moves.14... f6: The game is looking quite unpleasant for black don't you think?
moves.15. Ned4 e5 16. Bc3: Finally, black resigns, the Queen is trapped and will soon be lost, plus there are threats of Qxa8 and Qc8+ and all sorts of stuff. Hope you enjoyed, thank you!
